Title: Full-Time Design Advisor for Joss & Main (A Wayfair Specialty Brand)
RoleDescription:
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our Joss & Main retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store  might be the future home for your career.
The pay for this position is $19.55-22.85/hr, however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
 
Overview:
At Wayfair, we believe everyone deserves a home they loveand as a Design Advisor, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.
This role blends creativity and strategy, giving you the tools to inspire and the autonomy to deliver results. From room layouts to fabric swatches, your design solutions will reflect each customers unique style, budget, and needs. Were not just a storewere a community of creators, doers, and dreamers. At Wayfair, youll join a team that cheers each other on, celebrates wins big and small, and knows that building beautiful homes should also be fun.
Ready to help customers fall in love with their homesand your career? Lets make it happen.
What Does A Retail Design Advisor Do?

Be the Customers Trusted Advisor: Greet, listen, and learn. Youll lead design consultations that feel more like conversations, getting to know your customers style, needs, and how they really live. Whether its a growing family, a new pet, or a dream remodel, youll help it all come together beautifully.
Turn Vision Into Reality: Create stunning, functional spaces using your design expertisethink color theory, spatial planning , textiles, and trend-savvy picks. You'll walk customers through fabric swatches, finishes, and product choices with confidence and clarity.
Inspire with Tech + Tools: Build out 2D/3D room views, mood boards, and persuasive presentations using our design software. (Bonus points if youve dabbled in tools like SketchUp, DesignFiles, Floorplanner, Icovia, or a similar tool!)
Always Be Designing (and Selling): Every interaction is a chance to build trust and drive results. Youll grow sales by turning design dreams into shoppable plansand guiding customers every step of the way.
Multitask with Purpose: Balance design appointments, sales floor chats, team collabsyoull handle it all with a positive attitude and a flexible mindset.
Be a Team Player: Pitch in on floor sets, help with replenishment, and share your best design hacks with the team. We grow together here.
Drive Sales with Style: Every interaction is an opportunity to build trust, grow your pipeline, and close the loop on beautiful, functional spaces. Youll actively seek out leads and help customers take the next step.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

Sales Chops: 2+ years of sales experience, ideally with higher price-point products or in a design-related retail environment.
Design Know-How: At least 1 year of experience in interior, architectural, or graphic designplus a solid grasp of spatial planning, color theory, and style trends.
Flexibility: Open availability, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready when your customers are
Team Spirit: You shine in a collaborative, cross-functional environment and love being part of a supportive, high-performing crew.
Great People Skills: You're a strong communicator with the confidence to guide, advise, and build trust with customers from all walks of life.
A Hustle Mindset: You thrive in a fast-paced setting and know how to prioritize like a prowhether you're juggling back-to-back appointments or jumping in to help on the floor.
A Design-Driven Background: A bachelors degree or equivalent design-related education is a plus, but not a deal-breaker. Passion and skill go a long way!

 

Able to speak, read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

Physical Demands

Frequent: Standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms
Occasional: Sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling

Lifting Requirements: Ability to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs on a regular, frequent, or occasional basis
Vision Requirements: Close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus

Working Environment

Exposure to varying temperature conditions
Occasional exposure to noise and physical activity related to the role
Minimal exposure to workplace hazards

RoleDescription:
Summer 2025 Start
Location: Toronto, CA

The salary range for this position is $120,000-124,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
This is a Toronto, CA based opportunity with a 3 day in office expectation.

 
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Partnering with Product, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair, our Native App Engineering teams contribute to an award-winning mobile experience that makes shopping for your home delightful and engaging. iOS and Android engineers leverage the full capabilities of mobile devices and their SDKs. A strong understanding of computer programming fundamentals, interacting with endpoints, debugging, and memory management.
An understanding of design patterns as well as architecture patterns.
A drive to learn about new libraries and technologies, stay on the cutting edge of the evolving mobile landscape and an eagerness to create experiences that will delight users.

Knowledge of Human Interface Guidelines, iOS UI/UX development, and best practices
SwiftUI, Combine, and GraphQL

RoleDescription:
AllModern, Senior Merchandise Associate
Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main)
Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main) target the $60B specialty furniture market and are incremental to Wayfair LLC.  These brands provide a tightly curated assortment of highly stylish and elevated quality products for the style-obsessed specialty customer.  
What You'll Do
In the Senior Merchandise Associate role you will manage a category for one of the Specialty Retail Brands.  As the category expert, you will be responsible for bringing the brand style and vision to life by owning the category assortment and presentation to our customers, as well as collaborating with our supplier partners and internal stakeholders to drive our brand identity across all channels.
Building and maintaining category assortment strategies for Kitchen & Dining; inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering

Building and maintaining relationships with key suppliers to deliver on category assortment needs and inclusion in Wayfair programs, such as major shopping holidays
Analyzing core business KPIs and partnering closely with cross-functional teams on inventory, merchandising, marketing, and profit management to drive business results
Identifying opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis and internal performance monitoring as data points
Owning product curation and category growth efforts by maintaining a pulse on core competitive trends and customer needs
Attending supplier meetings and trade shows (virtually and/or in person) and leading meetings with suppliers to communicate on business performance and opportunities within the Specialty Retail Brands

What You'll Need

~4+ years of experience within an e-commerce or corporate retail organization preferred. Preferably experience in buying/retail merchandising or retail home furnishing planning. 
A strong interest in building a career in buying and/or supplier relationship management
A passion or knowledge of industry trends, style and product design 
Ability to understand a brand vision, aesthetic, and customer base and how to bring that to life through the product assortment
Ability to cut data and think critically about the business; ability to understand and interpret sales and performance trends and apply learning to the business  
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the ability to influence cross-functionally
A personable and energetic communicator, eager to build relationships with new business partners - both internally and externally

RoleDescription:

Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are seeking a highly motivated Backend Software Engineer to join the Ad Signals team. This team is responsible for developing robust platforms and integrations that facilitate critical Marketing, Data Engineering, and Fraud Detection initiatives. Key responsibilities include managing services that transmit user activity data to advertising partners, thereby ensuring precise ad targeting. Additionally, the team oversees services for tracking performance data downloads and marketing campaign information, which are instrumental in enhancing our data science models.
What Youll Do:
Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions.
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.
We Are a Match Because You Have:

3-5 years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience

Experience with SOAR/SIEM technologies
Experience with incident detection and remediation
Working knowledge of threat vectors, vulnerabilities, and what anomalies to look for

Python experience to build and automate tooling

Title: Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Tech
RoleDescription:
Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Tech
Job Description
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What Youll Do:

Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

6+ years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with Java , Spring Boot andMicroservices . 
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).
